diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,28 @@
+#pragma once
+
+#include <functional>
+#include <iostream>
+
+namespace c10 {
+
+enum class DeviceId : uint8_t {
+    UNDEFINED,
body: As pointed out on https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/8389#discussion_r194973077, existing implementations and serializations use 0 as CPU to start the DeviceId. Can we make things consistent and basically do CPU=0 here as well? I understand that having an UNDEFINED is good to enforce people to write the DeviceId, but it seems to be a big potential backward-breaking design change.
body_html: As pointed out on #8389 (comment), existing implementations and serializations use 0 as CPU to start the DeviceId. Can we make things consistent and basically do CPU=0 here as well? I understand that having an UNDEFINED is good to enforce people to write the DeviceId, but it seems to be a big potential backward-breaking design change.
body_text: As pointed out on #8389 (comment), existing implementations and serializations use 0 as CPU to start the DeviceId. Can we make things consistent and basically do CPU=0 here as well? I understand that having an UNDEFINED is good to enforce people to write the DeviceId, but it seems to be a big potential backward-breaking design change.
